meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by assonance.
meanings.sent1: The poet's assonantal verses flowed smoothly, creating a harmonious sound.
meanings.sent2: Her assonantal writing style made the poem sound musical and pleasant.
meanings.sent3: The assonantal words danced together in perfect rhythm on the page.
meanings.sent4: The assonantal melody of the song echoed through the room, captivating everyone.
meanings.sent5: The assonantal quality of the speech added a lyrical touch to the presentation.

meanings.sent1: The songwriter's assonantal lyrics were catchy and memorable.
meanings.sent2: The assonantal phrases in the speech created a sense of unity and coherence.
meanings.sent3: The assonantal patterns in the text played a subtle game with the reader's ears.
meanings.sent4: Her assonantal voice painted a colorful picture in the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The assonantal structure of the poem added a melodic touch to the writing.

meanings.sent1: The assonantal composition of the song gave it a unique and memorable quality.
meanings.sent2: The assonantal nature of the speech made it easy to listen to and understand.
meanings.sent3: The assonantal elements in the story intertwined beautifully, creating a harmonious tale.
meanings.sent4: His assonantal style of writing painted vivid pictures in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The assonantal rhythm of the poem added a poetic charm to the verses.
